anime.description: * Based on a sci-fi seinen manga series written by http://anidb.net/cr51639 [Miyagawa Satoshi] and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr51638 [Itou Kei]. The human race extended its life field and greed to the vast reaches of space... In Space Era 0156, a war breaks out amidst all of the colonies in space. Earth begins to construct a new space battleship called Tiramisu in secret. Just as the war begins, one genius pilot steers the Tiramisu as a beacon of hope for humanity. Source: M-U

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: STAND IN THE UNIVERSE / I`M NOT ALONE
Stand in the Universe / I`m Not Alone
Stand in the Universe / I`m Not Alone
episode.summary: The urge to urinate suddenly attacks Subaru and plunges him into an abyss of fear. Blaming himself for downing too many cold drinks will do him no good now, for he is already at the limits of his endurance. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BLUENESS / THE LAST VOLUME
Blueness / The Last Volume
Blueness / The Last Volume
episode.summary: When big-breasted female pilot Ligier Leroy joins the Tiramisu crew, Subaru is forced to fight in her mecha full of stuffed animals and lace. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: MY CUTE PUPPY / DO NOT DISTURB
My Cute Puppy / Do Not Disturb
My Cute Puppy / Do Not Disturb
episode.summary: Subaru picks up a stray Space Chihuahua and tries to secretly keep it as a pet. However, its unbelievable evolution prompts him to make a painful decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: FLY IN SPACE / NAKED DANCE
Fly in Space / Naked Dance
Fly in Space / Naked Dance
episode.summary: Subaru, an ace pilot aboard the Earth Union’s space battleship Tiramisu, starts to enjoy a fried pork cutlet skewer before going into battle. However, an accident sends him to the showers to wash off breadcrumbs. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: SMALL SCRATCH / HELLO MR.ROBOT
Small Scratch / Hello Mr. Robot
Small Scratch / Hello Mr. Robot
episode.summary: Trivial things cause Subaru and Isuzu’s relationship to unravel. Is this the beginning of a brotherly quarrel on a cosmic scale?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: LOST MEMORY / TRAGEDY IN THE LIQUID ROOM
Lost Memory / Tragedy in the Liquid Room
Lost Memory / Tragedy in the Liquid Room
episode.summary: Out of patience with the Tiramisu’s outrageous crew, Subaru has just decided to leave the ship when he unexpectedly reunites with his long-lost brother. The gears of fate begin to turn for these brothers chosen by the universe! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: HOLY NIGHT SCRAMBLE / DIM MEMORY
Holy Night Scramble / Dim Memory
Holy Night Scramble / Dim Memory
episode.summary: While the rest of the Tiramisu crew has a morale-boosting session with the captain, Subaru is getting excited about something else. What merry Holy Night festivity has Subaru always longed to partake in? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: DRIFTING WITHOUT SIDE DISHES
Drifting Without Side Dishes
Drifting Without Side Dishes
episode.summary: Subaru never foresaw the day he would learn how vital it is to have something to eat with your rice. Alone in space and surrounded by white rice, what desperate action will he take?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ATMOSPHERIC REENTRY / TO EARTH
Atmospheric Reentry / To Earth
Atmospheric Reentry / To Earth
episode.summary: In an ever-intensifying battle, the Tiramisu is pushed close to Earth’s atmosphere. When Subaru takes to the battlefield, Isuzu blocks his path. What fate awaits the Ichinose brothers? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: MAN’S WORLD
Man`s World
Man`s World
episode.summary: As Subaru`s beloved mecha is on the verge of collapse, memories of his time with the Durandal`s designer come rushing back to him. The reason the cockpit became Subaru`s sanctuary is about to be revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: NON-FICTION / REUNION WITH CHIBI
Non-Fiction / Reunion with Chibi
Non-Fiction / Reunion with Chibi
episode.summary: We now bring you a shocking documentary program. Join us as we shadow the every move of Subaru Ichinose, the ace pilot on whose young shoulders rests the heavy responsibility of protecting our Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BLACK IMPULSE / SUBARU, THE SPEED KING
Black Impulse / Subaru, the Speed King
Black Impulse / Subaru, the Speed King
episode.summary: A man who looks suspiciously like Subaru suddenly enters the fray. Who is the original, and who is the copy? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: RETURN OF THE ACE PILOT / A FRIEND OF MINE
Return of the Ace Pilot / A Friend of Mine
Return of the Ace Pilot / A Friend of Mine
episode.summary: Subaru returned to the Tiramisu only to find the Assist Bot PAC2-AR in his room. Now this new arrival’s scheming puts Subaru in dire straits! Source: crunchyroll

It`s Setsubun, Space Age 0157. Subaru sits with a sushi roll in his mouth, searching for this year`s lucky direction: "south-southeast and a bit to the right." Assailed by a series of unforeseen crises, can he finish his sushi before it`s too late? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: SENTO
Sento
Sento
episode.summary: The showers onboard the Tiramisu are out of order, so the crew makes a trip to Cosmo Bathhouse. Trapped in this nightmarish scenario of "letting it all hang out," Subaru finds solace in a miraculous reunion with Pube. But is this the same Pube he knew? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: GOOD NIGHT SUBARU
Good Night Subaru
Good Night Subaru
episode.summary: Captain Isuzu Ichinose of the People of Metus has personally infiltrated the Tiramisu in order to build trust between himself and his estranged brother. However, he soon learns that Subaru has become very high maintenance during their time apart. Source: crunchyroll
